nhs in nottingham on highest state of alert .
train staff member 'attacked ' at market harborough station .
fallen trees cause road closures across region .

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tomorrow morning .

documents.title: partial m1 closure for resurfacing work
text: the southbound carriageway on the m1 between junctions 25 and 24 near nottingham/derby is due to close for resurfacing work this evening .
it will be closed from 21:00 until 06:00 tomorrow .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: watch : tour of newark 's 'little house '
text: do you remember yesterday we told you about the `` little house '' in newark , which was sandwiched between a bank and the town hall ?
well today we have had a sneak peak .
it 's not known when the house was built or who previously lived in it but it is thought to pre-date the town hall built in 1776 .
patty temple , curator at newark town hall museum , is appealing for anyone with information to get in touch .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: further delays near m1 after crash
text: one lane is closed on the a42 between the a453 near leicestershire at the junction with the m1 because of a crash .
it is affecting traffic northbound .
a collision inv : 2 vehicles has closed 1 lane ( of 2 ) on the # a42 northbound between # a453 and m1/a453 in # leicestershire .
our @ twitterid # trafficofficers are en route .
expect delays .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: wassailers gather near southwell
text: ever heard of wassailing ?
well , it 's a pagan event to ward off evil spirits and bring about a good apple harvest and it 's been taking place near southwell .
it involves making loud noises to `` scare off spirits '' , crowning a king and queen and lighting fires .
author: Jack Maclaren
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: murder suspect detained in pakistan
text: murder suspect detained in pakistan

documents.title: m1 lane closure causing delays
text: one lane is closed on the m1 northbound near junction 24 for leicestershire because of a broken-down van .
this is causing more delays because it is in a roadworks area .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: karanka denies making bid for clayton
text: karanka denies making bid for clayton

documents.title: traffic flowing after city centre crash
text: congestion should be easing up on castle boulevard following a collision near abbey bridge earlier .
rtc castle boulevard abbey bridge is now clear and traffic is flowing in all directions
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: delays after reports of a60 crash
text: might be best to find an alternative route
# leicester .
# loughborough , we 're getting reports of an rtc on the a60 loughborough road bet cotes and hoton .
care needed in that area .

documents.title: police custody death man named
text: police custody death man named

documents.title: children choose name for new gritter
text: the newest gritter in leicestershire county council 's fleet has been given the name grittersaurus following a competition involving local primary school pupils .
a panel of judges decided the group effort by pupils at asfordby hill primary school was the best of the 290 entries they received .
other suggestions included sir grits a lot and salty mcgrit flinger .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: carson signs extended derby contract
text: carson signs extended derby contract

documents.title: gritters to be deployed
text: the gritters will be out in nottingham as temperatures are expected to drop tonight .
road temps will drop well below freezing this evening .
ice likely & there could be some wintry showers .
gritters will be going out # grittertwitter
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: cold weather turns off nottingham 's water fountains
text: the water feature at nottingham 's old market square has been turned off because of the cold weather today .
temperatures mean its internal thermostat has kicked in , stopping spray from the fountain forming ice on the pavement .
nottingham city council said one part of the fountain will be switched off tomorrow for some maintenance on a drain .
depending on the temperatures , the rest of the water feature is expected to be on .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: city centre delays after crash
text: drivers have been told to avoid castle boulevard in nottingham because of a crash .
rtc castle boulevard/ abbey bridge , avoid area use alternative route
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: warning of 'further tragedies ' at jail
text: in his letter chief inspector peter clarke told justice secretary david gauke there would be `` further tragedies '' unless safety measures were put in place at nottingham prison .
mr clarke said : `` the principal reason i have decided to issue an urgent notificationis because for the third time in a row hmi prisons has found the prison to be fundamentally unsafe . ''
nottingham prison currently holds about 1,000 men .
more than two-thirds of prisoners said they 'd felt unsafe in the jail at some time .
eight inmates are believed to have taken their own lives in the last two years .
author: Danny Shaw
BBC Home Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: school pupil cycle ban faces criticism
text: school pupil cycle ban faces criticism

documents.title: weather warning for snow and ice
text: the met office has issued yellow weather warnings for snow and ice for much of the east midlands .
there will be a mixture of rain and sleet falling at lower levels causing icy patches through this evening and into the morning .
this evening will also see some isolated wintry showers with clear spells at times .
it will be cold with the risk of icy patches forming and lows of -1c ( 30f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: breakingnottingham prison in 'dangerous state '
text: the justice secretary , david gauke , has been ordered to make immediate improvements to nottingham prison after he was warned the jail was `` fundamentally unsafe '' and in a `` dangerous state '' .
peter clarke , the chief inspector of prisons for england and wales , issued mr gauke with an `` urgent notification letter '' demanding action within 28 days .
it 's the first time the `` urgent notification '' process has been used since it was established last november .
eight prisoners at nottingham jail are believed to have taken their own lives in the last two years and levels of self-harm have risen significantly .
author: Danny Shaw
BBC Home Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: custody death man named by police
text: a man who died after falling ill shortly after being arrested by police in chesterfield has been named by the police watchdog .
shaun aherne , 42 , was arrested in pleasley during a reported domestic incident on 7 january .
he became unwell at a custody suite in chesterfield and died in hospital three days later .
the independent office for police conduct has started an investigation into derbyshire constabulary 's dealings with mr aherne before he fell ill .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham station fire : dashcam and phone footage wanted
text: british transport police have issued a further appeal for information about last week 's fire at nottingham railway station .
officers are trying to gather mobile phone or dashcam footage taken in or around the concourse either before , during or after the blaze .

the force said the fire , which was discovered in the ladies ' toilets on the southern concourse just after 06:15 on friday , has resulted in damages and financial losses that could run into the millions .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: gang 'smuggled cocaine into uk inside furniture '
text: a gang imported and distributed more than £ 10 million of cocaine , smuggled into the uk inside furniture , a jury was told .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: motorhome and bikes stolen in ram raids
text: a motorhome and bikes have been stolen during four ram raids .
officers are linking three raids in calverton and one in sherwood where a silver transit van was used to gain entry into businesses .
nottinghamshire police said the van reversed into three separate units in park road in calverton at about 05:30 on monday .
a motorhome , motorbikes and a distinctive specialist race bike ( were stolen .
a cross bike was also taken when a van rammed into a workshop in mansfield street in sherwood at about 19:20 on sunday .
police said three men were seen in the van , who were wearing dark clothing .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: chesterfield sign defender whitmore
text: chesterfield sign defender whitmore

documents.title: snow continues to disrupt travel
text: driving conditions are not getting any easier in the county .
a fourth derbyshire road is now closed due to snow .
heavy snowfall this morning forced the closure of the a53 leek road .
also still closed are : a537 cat & fiddle , a57 snake pass and a6024 holme moss .
all other routes passable with care .
stay safe .
hey , thanks for this update .
do you have anything new on a537 ?
hi rachael , it 's expected to be closed throughout the day and overnight , thanks
thank you !
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: massive brewing containers to be carried to m1
text: drivers have been warned a number of huge brewery vessels are to be transported from swadlincote to the m1 via burton and derby on tuesday night .
derbyshire police said patrol cars would be escorting the abnormal load - which will look similar to this - with exact timings to be confirmed .

on tuesday , january 23 , our @ twitterid officers will be helping to escort an abnormal load made up of huge brewery vessels ( similar to those from # swadlincote , through # burton & # derby and up to the # m1 .
more details will follow .
# abnormalload
can you pleae ensure that @ twitterid and myself as as ops manager get the details as this will impact on our bus services .
hi michael , we ca n't release full details of the route just yet as it is subject to change .
however , we will be releasing it nearer the date .
this post was just to give people , particularly motorists , prior warning .
do you have further details yet ?
what time will this be happening and what roads will be affected ?
hi heather , we have published the full route that the load will take on our facebook page :
the facebook comments on this post are
wonder if my old mate is on duty .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: water supply reconnected following railway station blaze
text: the water supply at nottingham railway station has been reconnected following a major blaze there last friday .
the fire burned for 12 hours after a new section of the station caught fire .

east midlands trains said it was working with suppliers to `` reopen all food outlets , ensure toilet facilities are fully operational and that drinking water and washing facilities are usable for customers '' .
portable toilets will remain on site while this work takes place .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: council disputes 'out-of-date ' care home findings
text: derbyshire county council has disputed a new study that suggested it was one of the three worst authorities in the country for the quality of its care homes .
consumer group which ?
analysed results of care quality commission inspections and said half of the council 's care homes were rated as inadequate or requiring improvement .
jean wharmby , cabinet member for adult care , accused which ?
of using out-of-date information that did not reflect the current situation .
she said : `` eight of our 22 homes are rated as requiring improvement .
we have no homes that are rated as inadequate .

there is a huge difference between an overall rating of requires improvement - which may relate to failing to keep paperwork up to date and not be a reflection on the quality of care provided to residents - and inadequate , which usually relates to significant concerns about the quality of care offered . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: catchment area changes planned for leicestershire schools
text: county education officials are proposing catchment area changes for three schools in the borough .
a public consultation is running to determine people 's thoughts on plans to introduce a new , merged catchment area for the westfield infant and junior schools and sketchley hill primary school .
author: Hinckley Times

documents.title: cctv appeal after house burglary
text: cctv footage has been released of a man police want to speak to in connection with a burglary at a house in wollaton .
nottinghamshire police said officers were following several lines of enquiry but they have been `` unsuccessful in identifying the man '' .
the burglary happened in hawton crescent at about 20:30 on 29 october but the footage has only just been released .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: decision to be made on 3,000-home development off a453
text: a decision could be made on a new 3,000-home development outside clifton after almost four years of waiting .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: drunk treatment centre could become permanent fixture
text: it 's hoped a service - which helps people who are drunk or suffer minor injuries on a night out - can become permanent .
police and paramedics have been using a dedicated vehicle parked in leicester city centre since before christmas and helped 200 people over the festive period .
the trial 's been extended to the end of march and the city council says it 's looking at how to continue funding it .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: council 'has over £ 235,000 of unpaid invoices with carillion '
text: the opposition leader of nottinghamshire county council , councillor alan rhodes , tweets
@ twitterid hears that the authority has over £ 235,000 of unpaid invoices with # carillon
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: watch : riding along with leicester 's 'extreme commuter '
text: leicester 's adham fisher has been `` extreme commuting '' all over the world since 2004 and has a guinness world record for the fastest time to travel to all of the berlin u-bahn metro stations .
his latest mission was to ride on as many oxford bus company routes as he could .
here 's how he got on .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: 'shot fired ' in residential street
text: police have stepped up patrols in top valley after a report of a shot being fired .
nottinghamshire police said it happened in whitcombe gardens at about 18:45 yesterday .
no-one was injured but an investigation is under way .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: heavy snow closes north derbyshire routes
text: conditions are still pretty challenging for drivers in north derbyshire .
the a537 cat & fiddle is closed following heavy snowfall this morning , during which a lorry jack-knifed on the road .
the a57 snake pass and a6024 holme moss remain closed and wo n't re-open today .
difficult conditions on the a53 leek road .
all other routes passable with care .
cig !
not a bloody flake down bristol way send me some no actually , send me loads send me all of it ! !
amazing photo .
wish we 'd got some snow down here in ilkeston .
i love it .
brings back childhood memories of living in dale abbey .
very happy times !
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: pub fence damaged by fallen tree
text: a tree crushed a fence at the queen victoria pub in syston last night .
it was caused by the strong winds across much of the east midlands .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: leicester sack manager shakespeare
text: leicester sack manager shakespeare

documents.title: council apology to victims of historic sex abuse
text: the leader of nottinghamshire county council has issued an apology to the victims of historical child sex abuse .
it comes after councillors approved the independent inquiry into child sexual abuse report at today 's full council meeting .

in part of her speech , councillor kay cutts , said : `` one of the greatest duties that can be bestowed on a person or an institution is the responsibility for the safety and upbringing of another 's child .
`` this is not something that we at nottinghamshire county council treat lightly . ''
the inquiry will look at 13 investigations across a wide range of institutions including local authorities .
it will identify failings , demand for accountability for these past failings as well as support victims to share their experience of sexual abuse .
in 2016 former social worker andris logins was jailed for 20 years after sexually abusing children at a care home where he worked in the 1980s .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: water back on in braunston
text: water supplies have returned to normal in braunston after being disrupted when a pipe burst in church street this morning .
severn trent has thanked customers for being patient while repairs were carried out .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: half of council-run care homes 'need improvement '
text: half of the care homes operated by derbyshire county council are either `` inadequate '' or `` require improvement '' , according to figures from the care quality commission ( cqc ) .

analysis of the cqc results , by the consumer group which ? , showed some of the 54 care providers that operate at least 12 homes in england had half or more of their premises classed as failing by the regulator .
the analysis put derbyshire county council in the bottom three with 10 failings homes out of 20 .
the county council is expected to discuss the report at its cabinet meeting today .
deputy leader simon spencer said : `` if there is an issue , we 'll have to look at it very carefully and take immediate action . ''
author: Press Association

documents.title: missing pensioner found safe
text: a 70-year-old woman who has been missing from her home in pinxton since tuesday has been found safe and well in tibshelf , police have said .
# missing woman renata slack has been found safe and well in # tibshelf .
renata was reported missing on tuesday , january 16 , and was found yesterday evening .
thank you to everyone who shared our appeal on social media .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: nhs in nottingham on highest state of alert
text: it has just been revealed the whole of the nhs system in the greater nottingham area has gone on to the highest state of alert because of winter pressures .
the status , known as opel 4 , is triggered when hospitals , gps and other primary care services are experiencing huge demand .
the latest figures from nhs england show the number of ambulance handover delays has reduced .
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: train staff member 'attacked ' at market harborough station
text: police officers boarded a train at market harborough railway station yesterday following reports a passenger and crew member had been assaulted .
british transport police said there had been no arrests over the trouble , which happened at about 17:11 .
in a statement , the force said : `` we were called to market harborough station following reports of an incident on board a train .
`` officers attended the station and are currently investigating an allegation of an assault on a passenger and a member of train staff .
`` anyone who has information or saw what happened should contact us by calling 0800 40 50 40 quoting ref 382 of 17/01/18 . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: rams sign striker jerome from norwich
text: rams sign striker jerome from norwich

documents.title: bus stop crushed by fallen tree
text: a fallen tree has crushed a bus stop in narborough during the windy weather .
author: Amy Harris
Reporter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: school closed after tree and lamppost collapse
text: a school in barrow upon soar has closed for the day after a tree fell over near its entrance in high winds , taking a lamppost with it .
jill walton , headteacher of humphrey perkins school , said pupils walking to school were being put at risk by cars having to turn round in the road .
she said : `` it quickly became clear we were n't able to guarantee the health and safety of our pupils . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : tree down in oadby
text: ready for another fallen tree ?
this one happened in oadby and was snapped by one of our weather watchers .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: windy weather causes tree to fall at park
text: a tree has fallen across a small bridge at west bridgford park because of the windy weather last night .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: fallen tree at victoria embankment
text: part of victoria embankment in nottingham has been cordoned off because of a fallen tree .
it was caused by the strong winds last night .
author: Andy Whittaker
Presenter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: tigers quartet included in squad for six nations opener
text: four leicester tigers players have been included in england 's 35-man squad for their six nations opener against italy on 4 february .
jonny may , george ford , ben youngs and dan cole ( have all made the squad .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: more snow expected in derbyshire
text: the met office has issued a yellow warning for snow and ice in derbyshire for between 11:00 today and 23:55 tomorrow .
it says high ground could see up to 15cm snow , although things wo n't be as severe here as they are in scotland .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: air ambulance starts 24/7 operation
text: lincolnshire and nottinghamshire 's air ambulance is to start operating 24 hours a day .
at the moment , crews only respond to medical emergencies between 07:00 and 19:00 .
the charity says it will increase the annual running costs from £ 2.5m to £ 4m .
but the charity says its confident it will be able to raise the money needed .
it 's a pivotal moment in the charity 's history and we 're really proud and delighted to announce we 're moving to a 24/7 operation .
it 's only thanks to the fantastic fundraising support we receive from the communities of lincolnshire and nottinghamshire that we can do that .

documents.title: storm blows fence panels onto pavement
text: the windy weather left this fence in a rather sorry state in radford this morning .
police said they had made the area safe and alerted the land owner .
officers were alerted to this damaged fencing in radford this morning following high winds and # stormfionn .
area cordoned off by our @ twitterid colleagues , landlord made aware and will be secured asap .
# teamwork helping keep nottingham # safe
amazing the phone box is ok
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: storm brings down at least 35 trees in notts
text: thankfully we 've not heard of any injuries .
35 trees down in notts overnight & we 're still receiving reports .
includes a614 near lime lane junction stopping northbound traffic & close to travellers rest on mapperley plains .
@ twitterid emergency response teams working to clear all as quickly as possible
greetings .
where can i see the latest on the tree clearing in mapperley please ?
via 's team are still out about , but trees at mapperley plains & lime lane have both been cleared
cheers .
good stuff .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: fallen trees lead to rail disruption
text: something to bear in mind if your plans for today involving getting a train .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: power cuts hit hundreds in leicestershire and rutland
text: hundreds of properties in leicestershire and rutland are without power following last night 's high winds across the region .

according to western power distribution 's live information , the two main power cuts appear to be in cottesmore in rutland , where 673 properties are affected and market bosworth , where 168 are without power .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: fallen trees causing disruption in derbyshire
text: the roads of derbyshire are littered with fallen trees and branches this morning after a night of high winds .
police say they 've been inundated with calls overnight and are dealing with a fallen tree on the slip road at the raynesway junction with the a52 .
further north , conditions have been made worse by overnight snow and some of the normally affected routes in the peak district are shut .
police have urged drivers to take extra care and to not ignore road closure signs if they come across them .
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: wind blows trampoline into garden
text: this must have been a bit of a surprise .
this wind is crazy ! ! !
just looked out the window to find someone else trampoline and netting in my garden from 5 houses away # nottingham # stormfionn
hi hayley , i 'm a reporter at bbc east midlands .
is there any chance we could use this photo too ?
thanks alex .
yes you can use it
thanks !
where abouts in notts was it taken ?
broxtowe
wow !
can we use your photo on the bbc website and social media pages please ?
yes that 's fine
thanks very much

and this van in beeston found itself in the wrong place at the wrong time .
thankfully no-one was hurt .

these include 168 in market bosworth , 59 in long eaton , 77 near mansfield and 36 near wessington .

text: the wind has caused a number of trees to fall across the east midlands - this is on titchborne street in leicester .
